message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.DS

This paper is about a novel graph-based approach for collaborative ranking, which is a subfield of recommender systems. The paper addresses the problem of data sparsity in neighbor-based collaborative filtering, which is a common issue in information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG). The proposed approach uses a tripartite graph structure to model users' choice context, which involves graph theory and network analysis (cs.SI). The approach also uses personalized PageRank algorithm, which is a popular method in system dynamics and control (cs.SY). Finally, the experimental results involve performance evaluation and comparison of different recommendation algorithms, which is a common practice in data science (cs.DS).
